Cognition: What video games teach us about learning and literacy

Summary

This book discusses the role of videogames in major cognitive activities, including ways to develop identities, how we understand the meaning through semiotics, and how we perceive the world.

The author takes an optimistic view of video games, and also introduces a list of learning principles and explains how they can be applied to daily life.

Resource Details

Dolphin: Zhuang

Type: Book

Title: What video games have to teach us about learning and literacy

Date: 2007

Author(s): James Paul Gee

Published In/By: Palgrave Macmillan Trade

APA: Gee, J. P. (2003). What video games have to teach us about learning and literacy. New York: Palgrave Macmillan.

Link: http://www.amazon.com/Video-Learning-Literacy-Second-Edition/dp/1403984530

About

The Meowing Dolphins were established in April of 2015 as a fine group of procrastinators and resource-gatherers. The Dolphins' diet include various food items available at Taste Baguette, but not including those on the expensive side of the menu. We're happy to accept donations for meals at anytime.
